description: a burrito according to their menu online is $4.49. A burrito in store is about $8. Didn't expect to be paying double, especially when on their own website it's half the price
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Been a little while since I left a review, but being as I'm sitting at my desk with my laptop open, I feel like I should. I actually opted not to finish the wet burrito (alpastor chicken) because I didn't want to waste an entire meal, so I heated up some leftovers from the work fridge instead. The food is okay, if you just want something to fill your stomach. The price is okay too, but the food is just tasteless. The red sauce for the "wet" part of the burrito was basically red water. Nothing wrong with the service or the atmosphere, just the food can't just be an accompaniment to Tapatio (although, some might argue differently!).
author: Kevin L.

description:
1/31/18

Firstly, one should be aware that despite its name there is nothing gourmet about this place.  In fact, I'll just say right now that the only reason I am giving above-average marks is simply because the food's a good deal and tastes alright.  But no, do not expect anything "gourmet" about anything here.  Everything is average quality and cooked alright, but portions are relatively large and CHEAP, especially for a place right in the heart of downtown SF.

It's basically a mom & pop Chipotle.  Same idea, same layout, similar choices, but all hole-in-the-wall style, and CHEAPER.

1. Regular Burrito, Pork $7.36:  You know they're seriously giving you the absolute best deal possible when their prices are set down to the single cent!  Unfortunately I would say the biggest mark against them would be that the meat choices were clearly all cooked hours before and not kept that fresh. The carne asada looked sad, nearing its end of life at the bottom of the container, so I skipped that and got their carnitas (oops, sorry, meant "pork") instead.  Also loaded up with everything, including a HUGE helping to guac.  That's right, no extra charge for guac!!!

Sad thing is, walking to my car my bag tore from the shear weight of their burrito!--and plop it fell onto the garage floor along with all the chips they stuffed in there.  (Oh yeah, does Chipotle give free chips?--hell no.)  Luckily the foil was wrapped like 3x over so it wasn't punctured, but was a huge pain to wrap ha ha!  Anyway, sure enough, upon getting some of that foil off I noticed the innards have burst through in a hole.  Oh well, my fault.  How was it?--well, it was stuffed full of refried beans (my choice), guac, and sour cream so pretty much a stew of heart-attack, just the way I like it!  The pork was stringy and not very flavorful, but hell, I just paid $7.36 for what would be $10+ at Chipotle which still wouldn't taste as good.  So, not too bad.  For the price, 7.5/10

Again, it's all about the bargain here and getting that silent heart attack in for the day.  Enjoy!

4/5

#mexican #sanfrancisco
author: Dean C.

description: We aren't local here in San Francisco. My grandparents and I stopped here for a bite to eat and the lady, the mom, who I'm guessing is the owner of the shop, had a huge attitude. I'm always down for giving people the benefit of the doubt but it was just a lot. My grandma said something to one of the male workers, who was her son. I guess he told her and she took it upon herself to approach my grandmother and say how it's wrong to talk to her employees and how she isn't allowed to talk to her employees. She also told my grandpa that he was threatening her by looking at her LOL... RIGHT? When I told her it was just his face she goes "how am I supposed to know it's just his face?" Are you kidding me? Lol. She threatened to call security AFTER we paid and sat down. She never did, probably because she was acting CRAZY. I'd use a lot of words for this old lady but I want people to see this. ALSO THE FOOD, is gross. She was coughing on the lettuce as she was making our stuff... BTW. If you want a CAESAR SALAD, all you're gonna get is lettuce and ranch. No croutons, cheese, tomatoes, nothing lol. LETTUCE AND RANCH. $27 bucks for two burritos and some lettuce. ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK
author: Niecee G.

description: I went here on accident and totally do not regret it one bit! I ordered a veggie salad and the owner let me do half grilled veggies and half tofu. I paid about $10 for this salad. There was a lot to this salad and it was heavy! I am going to eat the other half today. Also received a small bag of complimentary chips. Definitely will go here again. Thank you for making such an affordable, delicious and healthy menu. It's good for someone on a budget and trying to be healthy. I also always voucher for great service!
author: Robyn H.

description: I have tried more than once to like this place, but after my last two times I am pulling the plug.  No carne asada ever and its on the menu.  Also they will not let you make your own style burrito,If it is a variation of any menu item they will not make it. Not accommodating and just not good Mexican food.
author: thekidd b.

description:
Stumbled in here by mistake. Was actually looking for another burrito spot but walked past this and saw there was a short line so headed in.

Service was A+. The husband and wife (I assume) team work great together. So refreshing to see mom and pop shops still exist in the Fidi of all places. 

The food was just 'ok' but well worth the $9 I paid. They also accept credit card which was nice. 

Will visit again!
author: V I P.

description:
Same concept as chipotle, except a bigger and more interesting options. Multiple options of beans, few more options of chicken, including society and curry. They also offer low fat tortilla. 

Have a feel of a little Mexico and a mom-pop shop, so it's cool. 

Food bar Service is very good and friendly.
author: Mike S.

description: Walked over to Alex's on my lunch break the other day because I was jonesing for some nachos, my first impression of the establishment was that they had nice decor and it seemed fairly upscale for a taco joint. Upon walking up to order I was disappointed to see a salad bar type of set up. After briefly scanning the menu since I had never been there, I ordered steak nachos. The lady who I ordered from scowled at me, I'm assuming because she was anticipating that I would order a burrito and had to put the tortilla/foil back. At this point I knew I wasn't going to get much love in my nachos, but I would never have imagined the ingredient that was (probably purposely) left off. Cheese. My nachos did not have cheese. Unfortunately I didn't look at the nachos until I got back to my office. At that point I didn't have time to walk back to have the mistake corrected. But is safe to say I will never go to Alex's again, unless for some reason I decide that I am craving nachos made with an attitude.
author: Will P.

description: Breakfast box was pretty good, especially  he chorizo. Went in at 10 and place was dirty and picked over.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Did you hear that "ding?"  Yes, that was them microwaving my carne asada, not for a burrito, but for the two tacos I ordered.

Though you couldn't tell from my photo that I ordered two tacos.

Looks more like a salad.

There's nothing worse than overcooked microwaved meat.

Oh yeah, they microwaved the meat for my tacos and piled a ton of lettuce to cover up the evidence!

And at around $9 this place has me scratching my head wondering why I set foot in here instead of going to Chipotle down the street.
author: Jack R.

description: The breakfast burrito was very good. The chef is a sweet afghan lady with a very pleasant demeanor. Their hot sauces weren't spicy enough for me, but otherwise this is a solid place !
author: Rahul K.

description:
I could probably make a better burrito at my house! hella bland, ran out of Carne Asada.  Homestly, these people aren't even trying. No one is ever there, and when you do go in, they barely have enough meat to serve to people. Weird business model. Weird food. Strange. 

Totally flavorless, and quite lame!!!
author: Jim B.

description: Turn back. Do not enter. There is nothing GOURMET about it. Taco Bell makes a better burrito.
author: Ellie E.

description: Ordered the eggless burrito due to allergies but the only ingredient available at 7:30 am was potatoes since the Rice and beans were still cooking. I settled for a breakfast burrito with potatoes, salsa and Guacamole. I still got charged  the full price of $7.00. A serious rip off, will not go back.
author: Kam H.

description: I worked in the transamerica pyramid and ate here weekly for breakfast. I brought co workers here and they immediately loved it as much as I did. The husband and wife owners were always very nice and gave the occasional free side of sour cream since I was there so frequently. I usually only ate the breakfast burritos so I can't vouch for the lunch burritos. If you're looking for a great and filling breakfast, look no further !
author: Johnny L.

description: Nothing Gourmet about it! Yuck! $3.91 for a "taco" that starts in the microwave?! The first thing I see them do is microwave the tortillas? Who does that? If you claim to be a taco and burrito place buy yourself a grill. My so called taco consisted of two very dried out microwaved tortillas with dry chicken.., that's it? For $3.91 a taco, rip off. No salsa, no beans, no fresh ingredients like maybe cilantro and onion. My friend got a burrito and was charged all these extra fees for stuff that should already come on s burrito. These folks know nothing about Mexican tacos and burritos. Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Lorena C.

description: Came in for a quick breakfast burrito.  Very tasty, very friendly staff.  Will have to come back for the tacos and burritos.
author: Doug P.

description: My favorite burrito place downtown. The lady is super nice and the options are all great. Not sure what else you can ask for in a burrito place.
author: Nicholas S.

description: I don't know how anyone can give this place more than a star.  And I don't know why they even call them selves gourmet because nothing is gourmet about this place.  I went here years ago and happened to walk by it today, and felt compelled to review them.  They microwaved my burrito from what I remember.  That's all that stuck with me. I couldn't believe they microwaved it.  AND I can't believe they are still in business.  Terrible place with terrible food.  Never ever coming back.
author: Jill P.

description: Food was underwhelming and price was high for such mediocre quality.  Don't recommend...
author: Joey E.

description: Not gourmet to begin with. Not authentic in any sense of the word.  Food is horrible.
author: John R.

description: The employees are very nice and welcoming but the food is extremely bland. Pork was very salty and the pastor was decent yet still bland. Not worth 14.00 for two tacos. I also didn't like the guy didn't wear any gloves and microwaved the tortillas. Not my idea of "gourmet" but then again I'm from Phoenix and know what bomb ass mexican food is :).
author: Jessica W.

description: I ordered a breakfast burrito and the owner tried charging me and additional 30% because he claimed that I asked him to add potatoes. Upon telling him that I was not advised that potatoes were an additional charge, he went into a tirade about how cheap I was and started swearing at me using expletives that truly shocked me at 7:30 in the morning. His wife had to calm him down while I calmly left the restaurant whereupon I headed to Specialties for a more sane experience. The owner is crazy - - if you go, make sure that you ask about any hidden additional charges or be ready to be abuse. Yikes!!
author: Jeff L.

description:
Being unable to give ZERO stars.. 
The owners (husband/ wife?) are terrible.  Mainly the RUDE wife.  She cooks (combines) everything and all he seems to do is ring up orders (no matter how long the line)
Today I ordered the ONLY nachos option on the board.  
Not "super" or "regular"-- there was one listing: Nachos: cheese; beans, salsa, sour cream, Guac

I ordered that.  I was asked "super?" And I said "no" because I didn't want meat (and that was the only addition to the otherwise basic nachos I could imagine). 
When I said no.  She seemed exasperated and slopped on gross nacho cheese (like at a little league game) NOT FRESH cheese.  And then one scoop of salsa.  No beans.  Nothing.  
I was happy to except the nachos as they were but I was curious as to what they were going to cost because I could not believe they would be charging $6.90 for what she just prepared for me. when I got to the register I asked the husband (?) What the cost of the nachos were because they were not up on the board ( at least not this abbreviated version) The wife then seemed very irritated that I was asking her husband how much the nachos are going to cost me and I pointed out that they were not in fact listed on the menu board. she then informed him not to serve me and then looked at me and said we don't need your business --I have a line of people. There was not a lot of people-!  Anyone  in line seemed equally petrified that a woman would get so enraged for me simply asking how much something cost.
Avoid this place! There are many other options nearby
author: Kelly C.

description:
My first time and I thought a good breakfast burrito would hit the spot for a good morning meal so I ordered their 'Breakfast Burrito' which mine was scrambled eggs, chorizo, salsa, and cheese.  The woman behind the counter (who seemed already irritated this morning) grabbed a tortilla then opened up the eggs which looked really dry, and so did the chorizo.  She put the eggs, chorizo, salsa, and then cheese on the tortilla.  I was really disappointed that she sprinkled so little cheese so I asked her if I could have more.  She then sprinkled a tiny bit more cheese and placed the whole thing in the microwave.  The microwave?  Really?  No steaming the tortilla first like other burrito places do?  Or even putting on the flat top to heat up?  Okay, I'll still go with this I guess.  After all, I placed my order not knowing.

When it came out of the microwave the cheese still looked skimpy and I asked if she would please still put more cheese on it (which irritated her even more) and then she threw it back in the microwave.  She tells me that she is going to leave it in there longer.  She walks over to the register and charges me .92 for the extra cheese.  I didn't mind paying that, but really, IT WAS NOT THAT MUCH MORE of a sprinkling of extra cheese.  Cost of the medium sized breakfast burrito?  $5.06 + .92 = $5.98 (and with an UGLY ATTITUDE at 9AM in the morning).  As she hands me my wrapped burrito she says "Have a nice day".  Really?  Why even try lady.

When I finally unwrapped my breakfast burrito the tortilla was hard (nuked for too long) and the eggs were dry still.  Not coming back so no thanks to you lady and your business.  No wonder the place is empty.
author: Emy B.

description:
Best spot in the FiDi for burritos!

Try the breakfast and lunch selections!
author: Josh R.

description:
Wow-- all I can say is two words:
Breakfast burritos. 

The potatoes in these beloved breakfast burritos are out of control delicious. A little bit of spice and a little bit of crispy, flash fried to golden delicious. When they run out, I will wait however long it takes for the next batch to cook up as they are that good. 

I found Alex'a by making slow concentric circles out of my office in FiDi looking for the best breakfast. Since I found Alex's the search is over. When I carry the burrito up to the office, everyone in the elevator asks me where? My colleagues all go to Alex's now and I bring friends in from out of town. 

If you are looking for a breakfast burrito I'm FiDi, put down your phone and run to Alex's and get these golden potato filled burritos STAT.
author: Edith L.

description: This is my go-to place for the mornings that I need a Venti Soy Latte (Startbucks is right next door) and a big breakfast burrito.  You can get it with sausage, chorizo, or bacon and it just hits the spot every time.  It's a small shop.  You can eat in or take out.  Service is always very friendly and quick.  I have yet to try the other items on the menu, but trust I'll be back for more!
author: Cecilia S.

description: Friendly staff, but the burrito was full of hard rice that looked and tasted both instant-style and leftover, scraped from bottom of the food warmer. Instead, head to Tlaloc down the street, which is worlds fresher and not much pricier.
author: Hillary D.

description: I come here weekly, this place is great. Mom & pop owned, they're very nice, great burritos/burrito bowls, affordable prices
author: Mike S.

description:
MAKE SURE YOU GET CHARGED CORRECTLY

I barely write reviews anymore, but this one got me back into it. I looked up and a regular burrito is $6.90. I get to the counter and your wife says its a Regular burrito. I give you a $20. You give me $11.35 in change. I even skipped on the paper bag just to be nice

Got back to my office, eating my burrito when it dawned on me, your charged me for a Super Burrito. That's not nice alex.... Keep the $1 you scammed from me.

I will never give you business again.
author: Jomeo D.

description: Very good burritos at a reasonable price. I don't know what the haters are talking about, this husband and wife team are also nice and helpful and the food is fresh and very good. I slammed the sandwich place next door which is evidently closed (which is a good thing because that place sucked balls) so I am not one who is hesitant to give a bad review when warranted but Alex's is great! I had a co-worker who literally went there everyday to get their spicy chicken burrito while I alternated between the carne asada and carnitas burritos. I also love the big Costco-sized bottles of different hot sauces on the tables. This is a VERY good place. Give them a try!
author: Athena S.

description:
Disappointed to say the least - I've come here for Breakfast burritos, and was hankering for one this morning.  I decided however to push my hunger out and get a burrito for lunch.  

The verde chicken sounded good, however when looking at it, the verde sauce was completely dried up, but I figured maybe what I was looking at wasn't the verde chicken.  

Well sadly it was and I now know the reason why it was dried up - it's because the person making the burrito uses the chicken SPARINGLY.  

That is to say, I ordered a super burrito and when I got back to my office to eat it, what I really got was a large portion of bland rice & beans, a few, I mean FEW pieces of thinly cut chicken and a teeny tiny amount of guacamole, cheese and sour cream.  ???  I was surprised how blatantly parsimonious the burrito maker was.  

Needless to say, there was nothing GOURMET about my burrito and I was not at all surprised that the burrito was DRY and tasteless and every bite I took seemed to be mostly RICE & BEANS.

Would I recommend this place to others, not at all!
author: Cris B.

description: I'm sitting here as I write this review, making this my last visit, sadly. Hands down the chicken verde here is pretty delicious, but that's about it. The owners use a microwave, which is quite concerning, hence why I have only gotten salads here. The chips taste like they're tostitos, and the corn is straight out of a can. Not to mention the rice is just plain bland. And yes, the woman has a bad attitude, especially towards other women I've witnessed. Reason I decided to stop coming here is because I feel like they pocket some hidden costs. How does a salad shoot up from 6.44 to 11.50 after adding a water? Doesn't make much sense. I'd rather wait in line at mixt greens and pay the same price. Don't waste your time.
author: Nicole B.

description: I have has several burritos from this place and they have always been decent.  Certainly far from the best and they do use the microwave for things like the wet burrito, but I have never had them use it on my food.  There is no real salsa option (as far as a salsa bar for instance) and it's not the spiciest place I have ever been to, but it was good.  Under ten bucks for a large burrito with al pastor (not really though, it was chicken, but was pretty good), cheese, sour cream and guac.  Like I said, far from the best but worth the $9 I paid.
author: Michael B.

description:
I was not expecting to find such delicious authentic Mexican food in the Financial District, of all places!  The outside of this burrito shop is pretty nondescript, I was in kind of a hurry to grab lunch, and my expectations weren't too high... However, this place turned out to be pretty awesome!  

They have a wide variety of fresh-cooked ingredients to choose from, including four different kinds of chicken alone.  The verde chicken was a delightful addition to my burrito-- just spicy enough, and very flavorful!  The woman (owner?) at the counter was very friendly and provided great customer service, warmly explaining the different topping choices, and also letting me know that they don't use lard in any of their beans.  Yay!  

Anyway, my burrito ended up being delicious and very filling, and I came back again a week later with the same great results.  I will definitely be back again if I'm craving a good burrito.

The only bad thing is they close pretty early, at 3pm, so don't plan on stopping by for dinner.
author: Emma M.

description: Fish tacos were delicious, but kinda disrupted the flow of the checkout line (they take awhile). While I waited the place hit the lunch rush and 100% of people were getting burritos and those were made fast and fat. They looked terrific.
author: Hal L.

description:
This place is a joke right?  Tried supporting a Mom&Pop burrito shop, but let me just say, the Mom&Pop shop slapped me big time in the face. And their food was gross. Blech!

Came here with a co-worker during lunch.  I kept telling her, "There's no one inside - there's no line! you sure this place is good?" Lo and behold there's a damn good reason why no one was inside...

The service stinks, stinks real bad!!!  We ordered a cajun chicken burrito and asked the woman at the counter to add cheese.  She disregarded our request and started wrapping the burrito in foil.  We made the request again before she finished and she added it in eventually. Being two smaller asian girls, we decided to share it.  The woman at the counter flipped out on us when we asked her to cut it in half, snapping back that she wouldn't recommend it. When we insisted, she reluctantly cut it.

When we were done eating we picked up our plate to place it somewhere or give it back to them...didn't know because we've never been there and there wasn't a trash can to place it on top of.  The mean b**** bitched at us to leave the plate on the table.

Excuse me dude, we're giving you business so why are you mad at us?  Your little spot was dead empty before we came in.  Are you upset that you had a customer?  Sorry we didn't buy two items, but we're not THAT hungry and it's not really an inconvenience to you to cut it.  Rude, rude, rude!
author: Dee H.

description: The 4 stars is context-specific.  4 Stars for a FiDi burrito place.  I just went here for the first time and the price isn't too bad, the options are pretty varied, and it tastes better than many other options in the area (not necessarily the single BEST burrito in the area, but quick, close, and tasty).  Also, the folks behind the counter were both very nice.  I'm sure I'll be back in the future.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I have been getting delicious vegan breakfast burritos here for the last year - and didn't think twice about paying $7 for a burrito the size of my arm.  Recently I've decided to skip the tortilla and the lady has sent me merrily on my way with a very heavily laden container of beans, potatoes, salsa and guacamole for $6.

This morning - the eve of a long weekend - she couldn't quit telling me about how tired she was (ok...). Oh, and she didn't have any beans (because she was too tired to make them?)  Being a huge fan of potatoes and running short on time I told her it was ok - potatoes, salsa and guac would have to do.

She still charged me $5.45. When I expressed my shock considering the amount of food (1.25 cups total - 1 cup just potatoes - I just meausured in my office) she told me that her labor was very valuable.

Last time I checked your labor was valued by your patrons and she is now short one more of those.
author: Emily C.

description: Great food! Great people! The owners are attentive, caring, and truly make Alex Gourmet Burrito an excellent place to eat in SF! The food is delicious and I recommend the Cajun Chicken Burrito! Overall a wonderful place!
author: Sarah L.

description: Great burritos, especially the chili verde and chicken al pastor. They are quite large too. Good value for the super burrito. I haven't had anything other than burritos so can't speak to it. But honestly, this is a quick burrito place. If that's what you're looking for, you'll walk away happy. The owners are no-nonsense and try to get everyone out quickly with a solid burrito.
author: Yury G.

description:
Small business owner-operated? Check.

Mom n Pop doing all the work with their own hands? Check.

Real recipes representing their heritage? Check.

Best possible ingredients cooked fresh every day with love? CHECK MATE.

The couple who runs this place, John and Fahima, could not be lovelier or friendlier, and you taste it in the food. The eggs are light and fluffy and yet somehow creamy, the carnitas juicy and fatty and... um... carnitas-ey. And all it took from me was a word about not eating carbs and they know how to take everything and add up even more wonderful fat and protein on my plate and skip the filler. 

If you work in FIDI and are not eating here, you, my friend, are a sucker. There's a million burritos in the naked city, but only one is served with Love. :)
author: Brock D.

description: Some of the better Mexican food in the FiDi. Not superb, but pretty good. And Mrs. Alex is very nice. I am also told that they have breakfast, and though I haven't partaken of it, a co-worker of mine has and loves it.
author: Ryan P.

description: I came to give a guest lecture at AcademyX and happened to visit this joint.The lebanese music playing here brought me in along with the music in the park.Alex Gourmet Burrito has a really good location with the park and music playing to its advantage.However the food wasn't flavourful at all.The level of spice wasn't appropriate.The ingredients loose the flavour when all put together.The tofu was the saving grace in the vegetarian burrito.Not worth coming again.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Walked a mile to get the breakfast burritos since Yelp adversities a 6 am opening. The door was locked and the lady said it opens at 7. Disappointing. Please update the hours.
author: Ayesha B.

description:
My burrito was huge and while it was the stuff of usual burritos it seemed less "mass produced" than the likes of Taco Del Mar and other chain burrito bars.

Its located just off of the Redwood park at the base of the Transamerica Pyramid so after you get your burrito you call stroll thru the park and find a quiet tree to sit under and enjoy your lunch hour and pretend you are in a forest far away from the grind.
author: Antoine V.

description: Great tasting Buritto at a good price!  I come here several times a week and the food is consistently yummy! The owner's are warm and friendly and make the food fresh each morning.  So nice to have a mom and pop place in the financial district that makes REAL good food!
author: Sherri R.

description:
A co-worker told me he liked this place because they serve "authentic" burritos. I shouldn't have taken the word of a gringo, especially one who ordered a tofu burrito when we got there. 

I had a chicken burrito supreme. The chicken didn't have much flavor and the tortilla was undercooked. The pico de gallo was mostly onion and tomato water, with a few microscopic pieces of actual tomato or chile. 

Overall, one of the least satisfying burritos I've had. 

Note to owner:  Look up pico de gallo in a recipe book. I'm sure the main ingredient will be tomato.
author: Lee T.

description: this service is horrible  i will not recomend this " mexican restaurant  "   those  tacos  there not  look s like real tacos  and the girl  is always in a bad mood
author: Julio R.

description:
This is a great place for lunch around the Redwood Park area. Very friendly service, and great selection of food.

The "Super" burrito is very big, and I made the mistake of "my eyes being bigger than my stomach" and ordered it. It was very well made, and tasted great! Only able to finish 1/2, so I had a great late afternoon snack on my way out of SF.

The owners are great, and I would definitely recommend visiting if you are in the area!
author: Aaron B.

description:
I've eaten here a couple of times and I have one word: Gross.

- the place reaks of bleach, and has every time I've gone there
- they don't use real Guac
- the rice had a strange texture
- it expensive for the quality
- they don't always have what you want
- the service isn't that great
- the beans did look like they'd been out a while

I've never waited line here....I guess that should tell me someting......I won't go back.
author: Beth A.

description:
I was really dissapointed with my experience at this place.... I really wanted a burrito on my lunch break and this was the only place I could find that didn't have a huge line at 1pm, turns out there was a good reason why.  First off I wanted a quesadilla but the woman said she couldn't make me one because she was "cleaning the grill."  Really? You can't make me a quesadilla at 1PM on a wednesday? okay..... I'll get a super burrito with chicken.  I ask for chips and salsa and she says I can only have verde salsa because thats what everybody gets with chips, there isn't a choice on salsa....  hmmm.  I eat my burrito and the chicken is cold and the salsa is hot (temperature).  Apparently she had just made the salsa and it was still warm..... strange. 

I will avoid this place like the plague from now on
author: josh m.

description: It was the most difficult experience I've ever had ordering a burrito. The lady was very rude and the food was cold. She made prices up as she went along.  I don't mind paying a little extra for something I want but I don't want to be cheated either.  I will never go there again nor would I recommend it.
author: Michael J.

description: This place is great! Really good affordable Mexican food and friendly Staff. Get the mini burrito or burrito in a box (without tortilla) if you are craving a burrito but don't want to feel like you need to take a nap mid afternoon. Good stuff!!
author: Jordan V.

description:
I have eaten here a couple of times, the food is a good price for the portion and seemingly tastes well. But every time I eat here I end up getting sick! It's a mix between that feeling you get 5 minutes after finishing your McDonald's you thought was a good idea and the food poisoning you got visiting that third world country. It always seems like a good idea until you find yourself running to the bathroom every few hours for a week. I will never eat there again. 
Plus the owner is completely rude, straight to the point "what do you want." And she's sexes, only nice to guys. There is enough rudeness in the world, I don't need it when I'm ordering my lunch!
author: Jenna P.

description:
Went in with 2 friends around lunch time, purchased regular burrito with pollo asado. I'd never been here before for lunch, but something was definitely "off" with my food. It tasted/smelled old. 

When I called to let the owners know (in the interest of other customers, not for free crap, mind you), she lectured me about how all the food is fresh, this is not possible, I must be mistaken etc. and hurried me off the phone.

Bad business practice, food was not good at all...beware
author: Ben M.

description: It was a decent burrito. The rice for some reason, stood out to me and it was awesome! They have a lot of hot sauce choices on the bar which was nice. I'll go back if I am close by, and desperate.
author: Doug P.

description: I'm a tough critic when it comes to a good burrito- this place is tasty, consistent, simple and the lady behind the counter couldn't possibly be more friendly and hospitable!
author: Michelle O.

description:
family run burrito shop. The reason for 4 stars is that they have started of in a good way by differentiating by the meat's they have. I saw around 5 different chicken varieties , cajun , curried etc on the menu. The taste was quite good as well. 
so if you are bored of same tasting chipotle burrito this might be good for you.
author: Y U.

description:
Went yesterday on the way to school. I ordered the taquitos, which would take an extra few minutes. I waited. The woman behind the counter said they'd take a little longer than expected, and gave me some free chips. I ate, and I waited. About 10 minutes later, my taquitos arrived. They were average. Forgettable. Nothing that would make me sit and Yelp. I finished, said thank you, and left. 

15 minutes later I was in the fetal position on the bathroom floor, mourning the loss of significant portions of intestine and colon. 

I would strongly recommend not going to this place. Unless, of course, you hate your digestive system and want to fuck with it.
author: Aaron Z.

description: Had a delicious burrito here recently. Fair price, funny and efficient staff. :)
author: Jeff K.

description:
Got the Wet Burrito. It's no mission burrito but not a bad choice AND good price in the FiDi.

I'll go here again.
author: Ian C.

description:
There are no mission-style burritos in FiDi and this is the closest you will get [it is not that close].

Even my completely white cracker coworkers who commute from Palo Alto and wear pleated dockers agree:  these burritos are astonishingly bland.
author: Anthony L.

description: I got a chicken burrito with guacamole here. The service was downright grumpy and they were out of a lot of things other customers asked for, but they had everything for my limited order. I was given it to go without being asked and handed a plate when I wanted to eat it there. The burrito was good, not great but good and I left satisfied enough. There wasn't much ambiance in the dining area but I hadn't gone there looking for any so my expectations were met. It's a quick eat if you're in a hurry.
author: Michael P.

description: What a lousy, sloppy, wet burrito at a ridiculous price.  Wow, that was one of the worst I have had in the city!  I chose a tuff burrito and refused numerous items such as: meat, beans, cheese and sour cream; but when I asked for mixed vegetables, she informed me that they would be an additional $2.95. Seriously?  The entire cost of this very bad, soggy burrito was $10.22.  Never again would I go to this place!
author: A. D.

description: I'm seeing a lot of mixed reviews here and figured I'd put in my two cents. I've been coming here for the last few months for lunch. Initially I went as explored places near my new office. If you're looking for a traditional San Francisco burrito this place is about on par with most others. However, where they really shine for me is their curry and cajun burritos. Yeah not traditional but delicious. The curry one in particular I find really great with black beans and spicy salsa. Their salsa is hot without being overpowering. Quite lovely. It's perhaps a little pricey but you're in the financial district of San Francisco. The couple that runs this place are extremely friendly as well. I'd highly recommend going off the beaten path and trying their specials. I go here weekly and have no plans to stop.
author: Sam E.

description:
Okay, so I'm sort of a burrito snob.  But seriously?! 

I should have known it was a bad decision to get my lunch at Alex Gourmet Burrito when I walked in to a strong stench of bleach.  Blech!

There wasn't a long line and I ordered a veggie burrito.  My options according to the menu were mixed veggies or tofu.  I looked at the pan of steamed veggies heating and thought, "you better go with the tofu."  As luck would have it, I found out they had no tofu that day.  Okay...since I don't eat chicken, beef, or pork, I guess my option was to go with the oversteamed - who-knows-how-long-they've-been-sitting-there veggies.

The burrito was HUGE - but the ingredients were meh.  That just doesn't cut it for me.  Oh, and to pay extra for the super burrito is fine by me, except, please don't give me this unnatural green looking (i.e. not freshly made) guacamole.
author: Alvina W.

description:
Unlike the close by and ultra popular Tlaloc...at Alex's for $8 - you actually get a Mission Burrito sized Burrito with all the goodies you want....not the half-pint baby burrito served at Tlaloc down the street.

Cash only here...with ample seating inside and a park with benches just around the corner under the Transamerica Pyramid. 

I recommend and totally I heart the Chile Relleno Burrito...so delicious. 
A perfect little lunch in the Transamerica Pyramid shade - under a redwood tree. A true FiDi experience.
author: Katy A.

description: Best burrito in SF! their chicken al pastor is amazing! I get it every week and the owners are very nice.
author: Alex O.

description: I went here the other day for a taco salad and ended up throwing more than half of it away.  the guacamole wasn't real (what kind of Mexican place doesn't make - or at least use - real, fresh guacamole??), there was hardly any flavor in the carnitas, and it cost more than a salad at Mixt Greens.  it was ridiculous.  I should have realized that it wasn't going to be decent Mexican food when I noticed the sign hanging from the menu board saying they also served curry and wraps.  I will not be going back.  If you want good Mexican food, go to Tlaloc a few blocks down.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Hey, I made souffle and it ROCKED!  You're next, Beef Welly!

And no, I never ate here again.
author: Daryl E.

description:
Went here for the first time today, and it was my last time.  I ordered a regular chicken burrito and asked the cook to add a very small amount of cheese.  When I went to the cashier/owner to pay, a $4.61 burrito somehow turned into a $5.82 burrito.  I asked her why, and said it was because I asked for cheese.  I reminded her that the cook put about a 1/4 tsp of cheese on the burrito.  She told me that she'd let it go this time, but next time she would have to charge me.

I DON'T THINK SO!

And the burrito was stone dry.
author: .Hon H.

description: Food average.  Gourmet not really.  Owner very rude.  Go to Tlaloc much better for about the same price.
author: Adam J.

description:
It's hard to find a decent burrito in the Financial District. So hard in fact that I had almost given up on eating burrito's while at work. 

Then came Alex's. 

It's not the best burrito in the world, but it beats the hell out of El Faro. The Super Burrito is massive. The Nacho's are more "ballpark" nacho's than your typical mexican restaurant nacho's...Your standard chips covered in the Nacho cheese that you would get from 7-11. 

The owner(?) (Boss Lady) is always very nice and while they do charge more for every little extra, I haven't had a hard time getting her to waive the extra fee. 

All in all, it's a 3-star shop. It gets an extra star for being one of the very few decent places to get a burrito in the Financial District.
author: Justin B.

description:
While the ingredients were good and the service friendly, I was completely miffed by the fact that they would not make my co-workers burrito wet as he had not ordered the Super Burrito.  At fist she said it was "only 40 cents extra" whihc seemed ridiculous just for some sauce and as she went to and the sauce she realized that it was a regular burrito and gave the burrito back to him saying she could on make a super burrito wet.

My burrito was tasty but I still prefer the taco truck or the SoMa El Faro.
author: Noelle C.

description:
EDIT 06/2007:  For a more simple (and smaller) breakfast burrito, opt for the one at Fire House Cafe a few steps away.  I didn't find Alex's as appealing.  

-------------  

Located right next to Thai Corner Express off Sansome, Alex serves up pretty decent burritos.  Although I don't usually opt for tofu in my burrito if it's available, I wanted something heartier than rice and beans that day.  I left happy, but it looks like the breakfast burrito is getting all the rave reviews; I'll have to try that out one of these days.  

There's not much seating inside.  You're better off ordering take-out and eating it elsewhere, like outside in the courtyard area.  Regardless of where you feast, Alex is one of the better burrito joints in the Financial District.  But given the lack of options, it also isn't saying much.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Nice service. Good portions. Had a regular burrito and it was good.
author: Chellam C.

description:
I had the fish tacos. It took long to make and it taste like it frozen tv dinner. It was yuck!!!

Not recommended at all! I haven't tried the burritos but for sure NO, on the fish taco!
author: Tam T.

description:
Had a breakfast burrito craving after finishing a photo shoot of some scientists today and stopped by Alex for one.  They make a great breakfast burrito here - decent size (not too large or drippy), good meat (had the sausage one) and the price is fabulous ($4 includes tax!).

I am not down in the Financial District that much but this is a nice little spot for a quick burrito!
author: Gene X.

description: Service was actually not as bad as some are complaining on here. Burritos were huge and price was decent for the Financial District. The actual food was ok, not great. I ordered the Cajun Chicken Burrito and was expecting something spicy. Instead I found a bland, sorry excuse for a burrito. i even used Tapatio to make it taste like it didn't come from the back alley. They are a pretty standard burrito/taco shop so their menu doesn't stray too far from that.
author: Enoch L.

description:
*2.5 stars*

I went here for lunch last week for the first time.  When I was in the midst of ordering I spied the nacho cheese canister and my heart skipped a beat.  I then proceeded to order a super burrito (beef).  [I promised myself that I would return soon for my nachos.]  It was as huge as previous Yelpers proclaimed.  

When I got back to the office lunch room (to eat...  and hide) I told myself that I would only eat half and save the rest of it for the next day.  Half a burrito... then a 'slice' of  about an inch's worth of burrito...  I unwrapped the rest and polished off what was remaining of the burrito...  then lapsed into a food induced coma.  My fault.  Entirely.

Fast forward to today.

I got my nachos today - the super nachos with the refried beans and spicy salsa.  Even though the chick behind the counter heaved the huge bag of chips over my take out container, she only put about a layer and a half of chips then proceeded to DROWN my chips in beans and then the nacho cheese sauce (after stirring it for like, ages), then topped w/ the salsa, a smidgen of guacamole and a dollop or two of sour cream.

I practically ran to the office in giddy anticipation to eat...  also to fend off soggy chips syndrome (never order nachos 'to go').

Well, the chips were indeed soggy.  My bad.  [I should have eaten my lunch outside the restaurant (it was just a nice day).]  And completely hiding from me!  I had to fish out my chips with a fork (I hate having to do that).  The nacho cheese were a HUGE disappointment.  Totally lacked flavor.  I know, I know.  What can I expect when sauce like that comes from a can...  well, I've had many a canned nacho cheese that I did like!  Even the one from Costco is addictingly yummy.

Not sure when I'll be back - maybe for their burritos.  But for the next time I'm craving fake cheese nachos for lunch, I'll 'head for the border.'

P.S.  I think their prices have gone up from last week.  Damn!
author: Christine T.

description:
I get the breakfast burrito here..  I like it.  I wish it were spicier or had a touch more salt..  But otherwise, I think it's pretty good.  It's certainly priced reasonably well.  The lady here in the morning is always very nice to me.

Not much in terms of seating and it can get very busy.  I'd give this place 5-stars if the food was a touch better.  You gotta be really top-notch for me to give someone 5-stars...  But Alex Gourmet Burrito isn't far off the mark!
author: R G.

description:
Unlike the taco truck in front of my office, Alex's offers tofu burritos and fish tacos.  That's probably the only reason I ever go here, since I don't eat meat products.  

My tofu burrito-in-a-box (burrito in a bowl without the wrap) was $5.99 (same price as the regular burrito.)  It tasted ultra bland.  I know a tofu anything sounds pretty gross to the carnivores out there, but I've had way better tofu burritos at a couple Mexican restaurants near North Beach.  

I judge most Mexican restaurants on their chips and salsa.  Their chips were like the Mission Tortilla chips you buy from Safeway and were crumbs in a tiny 4x4 paper sleeve.  Also they didn't have a Salsa bar like most of the fast food Mexican restaurants in the area

I'd skip this place unless you're in a rush to get back to the office.  There was hardly a line at 12:00 pm.
author: Marilou A.

description:
my friends and i were looking for an inexpensive breakfast in the fidi. we popped in here because it didn't look too pretentious. 

they do have a decently sized menu for the small location. and my friends loved their vegetarian breakfast burritos (about $4.60 each plus tax). but my experience with the owner soured me on the place.

I ordered "a la carte" rice and beans. the owner gave me generous scoops of each (i chose refried, but they had whole pinto beans too). he asked if i wanted salsa with that, i said "sure". 

he then went to ring me up, and came up with $5. i was confused, i pointed to their a la carte menu, which said that rice or beans was $1.75 each. the menu that he was looking at was a hanging piece of paper that said "mini burritos". 

i hadn't realized that salsa cost extra, the owner said angrily "everything costs money". ok, but still, 78 cents for salsa, plus 3.50 for the sides does not equal $5. yes, it's a minuscule difference, but it's the principle of the thing!

 i felt like he was trying to pull something over on me. if he had just been polite and said "oops", i would have been ok with what was an apparent mistake. but he was pretty crabby with me. i asked if he was going to charge me for the "mini burrito", was he planning on giving me the tortillas? he stonily said "no". okayyy.

when we finished eating, i gathered up out plates and put them up at the register. by then he was all cheery and wished us a great day. 

i understand if he was having a bad day. I'm sure owning your own small restaurant in downtown, you get a lot of assholes, and it's a stressful job. but he didn't make a repeat customer, and he could have, as the food was decent. 

the salsa was chunky and pretty good, it was called spicy, but it wasn't really. they also have a mild option. the rice was short grain and kind of rounded, not your typical spanish/mexican rice, but i had no complaints. 

the place has about 8 or so small tables inside. 

soda is $2 for a cup from the machine, or $1.25 for a can, which seems counterintuitive, but whatever. they also have snapple and some other drink options, no alcohol.

they don't have a bathroom, but the starbucks right across from them does.
author: Anna S.

description:
I can't say there's anything super special about the lunch burritos that they make. But they're just simply delicious. 

I usually get the super burrito with beef. It's super huge, with all the fixings. Meat, rice, beans, sour cream, salsa, lettuce, etc. It's so big that I usually split it for two different meals. And when all those ingredients marinade together..... it creates this yummy sauce! It's not super pricey either. A super burrito is about 8 bucks. 

My only complaint is that the burrito I got today was not hot enough (I like my food steaming hot). 

Oh, and beware... they only take cash.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I've found myself struggling to finish off their super burritos multiple times and I have a pretty big appetite.  You get a ton of food for a decent price.  Though I haven't tried everything, they seem to have a good menu selection.

The service has always been fast and pleasant for me.  I've heard other people complain about service but I just walk in with a smile and say hello...that's all it really takes.

The only drawback is that it's cash only.  But it's also in the financial district so if you can't find a cash machine nearby, there's something wrong with you.
author: Andrew S.

description: This place is ok if you're in a rush. Really though the burritos are pretty bland. The ingredients look like they've been sitting out for a while. The price is ok for the financial district. The service is fast -- this place is never crowded. You can do better, even in the financial district.
author: Gabe R.

description: What makes this place 5 stars is the simple yet comforting food and the awesome service they give. I go here for breakfast and it's always satisfying. Nothing fancy, nothing special, just a great tasting breakfast burrito to fill me up in the morning. And only $4 :)
author: Quinallison D.

description:
I had hankering for a breakfast burrito this morning and since I didn't feel like doing my work quite yet, I browsed yelp for a new place to try out.  Alas, I'm currently eating a sausage breakfast burrito from Alex's.  

So let's start with the good.  No rice, no beans, no potatoes!  Awesome.  I hate cheap fillers in my burritos.  When you already have a flour tortilla why do you need to add more starches of rice and beans or potatoes to it?  I hate biting into something and feeling like I've just consumed enough carbs for a month.  And at $3.80 tax included, it's a pretty good deal.

The bad.  So apparently I made a mistake when I ordered the sausage because this stuff ain't normal sausage.  It's some sort of overcooked crumbly bacon bits or something.  Kind of gross in my opinion.  I would opt for the bacon one, though if they call this "sausage" I would hate to see what it is that they call bacon.

The neutral.  Everyone is raving about the size, and while I agree it's a good size, it's not that huge.  Honestly, I would be a little disappointed if it were any smaller.  And I've definitely seen bigger (i.e. breakfast burritos from Le Regency).  That said, I'm a guy with a fairly big appetite and this burrito will in no way keep me from eating a nice lunch.
author: Dubs W.

description: Burrito's are delicious , the service is quick and professional, and the overall package is 5/5 stars.
author: Jason S.

description: Very disappointing.  Ordered the fish tacos, which turns out are made with frozen fish filets and were inedible (rubbery and tasteless).  The rice also was extremely bland, and the guacamole doesn't seem to have much avocado in it, more like a green sauce.  And very overpriced, $9 for frozen fish filets is unreasonable.  The staff were nice but bothers me that they do not wear gloves when handling the food.  Ick.
author: Kay M.

description: I love this place. I work around the corner and have come to love Alex's. They serve huge burritos and are delicious. I like that they have different meats all the time so it doesn't get boring.  The couple who own it are very nice and always have a smile on their face.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Fridays=breakfast burrito from Alex's.

Awesome.

Worth it.

Enjoy.
author: Ryan C.

description: No way, are these canned beans!?  That's the first time I've had anyone try that in a $7 burrito.  +1 for originality.
author: Jared L.

description:
Had one of the best southwestern salads ever here today. Loads of chicken, salsa, black beans and corn. Appreciated the little extra of everything since I asked for no avocado, but the extra $2 for meat seemed a bit excessive. Either way, it was huge, and leftovers are sitting in the fridge.

Service was great, especially when I asked for barbecue sauce and was told it not an option, they offered green sauce instead. Brilliant compromise.
author: Jason B.

description:
I had the beef super burrito and it was really good.  The only slight downer was that is wasn't super hot - so near the end it was getting a bit chilly.  But the taste was great.
I reckon the ladies working in there read the reviews that they were hard arses (that is Australian spelling btw) - they were really friendly.
author: James R.

description: Love this place.  Inexpensive, good food, fast and friendly service.  I don't eat out much; usually I bring my lunch to work.  So when I do eat out, I want it to be a treat.  A burrito from this joint is definitely a treat.  I always get a grilled chicken combo burrito.  So good!
author: P.A. B.

description: OK - so I really enjoyed my vegetarian burrito this morning...the woman is still quite dour, and $5.10 is a bit pricey for a burrito, but it was a tasty and satisfying alternative now that my beloved Firehouse Cafe has closed its doors.
author: Stacy T.

description: I live in the Mission, and I work in FiDi, so I'm on the hunt for good burritos down here in the canyons with the mouth-breather broker-jock types.  I went to Alex's last week for the first time, and although the burrito was on par with any respectable Mission-based taqueria, the price was not.  I was ashamed to be paying $7 for what I got, and it was smaller than what I expected.
author: Drew P.

description: You ever jones for an authentic bomb of a burrito? I was having one such craving for lunch, so did my 'Yelpwork' to find any South of the border options in the FiDi I hadn't been to before. As it turns out, this place is in an alley only about six blocks from my office, so off I went. First of all, it's cute as hell, and no-nonsense. I knew I was on the right track. Unlike some of the reviews I'd read, the owner lady didn't assess any extra charges, but did keep calling me "Honey," which was quite endearing. I got the beef super burrito and it was EXACTLY what I had wanted (and gi-normous, especially for just $6.25 after tax), so I'm a fan. Now I have to go back to try one of those breakfast burritos the other Yelpers raved about -- and admittedly, to get called "Honey" again.
author: Gregor G.

description: This place rocks.  It's been in the little alley type courtyard between the TransAmerica building and the Fire Station for about a year.  They have totally killer breakfast burritos - really a full-size burrito (just with eggs and bacon/sausage, and goodness) for $4.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
these are some good burritos.  i was expecting shabby burritos but there is a lot of prep work that goes into all the ingredients, most notably the chicken mole which is very very good and made fresh every day.  the burritos themselves are well made and their array of beans are all very good as are their salsas.

the breakfast burritos are pretty darn good too and are big enough to tide you over from the morning til late afternoon.  i've tried both the veg and non-veg versions and both are quite excellent.

i was concerned about not getting some good mex in this area of the FiDi when my company's office moved but am happy to see that alex is providing some good stuff.
author: Swarup B.

description: The breakfast burritos are huge, I mean possibly too huge if there is such a thing. No, shame on me for even thinking such a thing. They are the perfect 4lb breakfast all neatly wrapped in a moist burrito, all neatly wrapped in foil. Just be prepared to cancel any lunch plans you may have had... and maybe think about hitting the gym you lazy gringos!
author: matt l.

description: This place is tha Bomb!... which unfortunately, is probably what you'll be dropping a few hours after consumption. The people here in the office are gonna hate me. Sorry... back to the review. Their breakfast burritos are friggin' amazing, the Super burritos are gigante AND they have an awesome wet burrito. I have yet to finish any of their burritos in one sitting but it's all good because I end up getting 2 meals out of just one burrito.
author: James C.

description:
While "Gourmet Burrito" definitely sounds better than "Mediocre Burrito" or "Gringo Burrito," it's way less accurate.  I tried this place today for the first and probably last time, and there ain't nothing gourmet about it.

Walking in, the space itself is sort of depressing.  There have been some half-hearted attempts at decoration, but it's just a plain, rather cramped room, with an entryway dominated by a fountain drink dispenser and a cooler full of bottled soft drinks (not a single extra-tasty glass-bottled Mexican Coke among them).  The dining room consists of a dozen or so teensy-tiny tables, hardly big enough for a single diner.  I saw three women push three tables together to try to sit as a group, and it didn't look too comfortable.

You order in front of a standard burrito counter, where they build the burrito as you walk along selecting the ingredients.  You can see through the glass to the meats and other burrito fixin's . . . but in this case, that's not really a good thing.  I was going to get refried beans, as I usually do, but after seeing how difficult it was for the server to pull the ladle through their dry-looking, congealed mass, I opted for some less questionable-looking pintos.  Then I was offered a meat choice of beef, chicken, or pork.  "Carnitas?" I asked, wondering if the pork was prepared that way or al pastor or what.  The lady behind the counter said "Yes" and I got carnitas; I'm still not sure if they do other preparations.  I made my burrito a super, and so they spooned on some runny guacamole, a glob of sour cream, and half a handful of institutional-looking cheese.  The salsa looked fresh and homemade, which was nice, but not so nice was their keeping it behind the counter.  I guess you have to pay extra if you want a side with your chips.  Lame, lame, lame.

The guy ringing up the orders was giving everybody their order to go, regardless of what was requested and despite the dining room being half-empty.  Diners kept coming back up to the counter asking for plates, which were provided without any recognition that the cashier, and not the diner, had made the error.

I said "for here" three different times and actually got mine on a plate.  I almost wished I hadn't.  A fat foil-wrapped slab skittering from one side to the other of a plain white plate does not exactly whet the appetite.  I realize it's just a burrito joint and that it's foolish to look for too much in the way of presentation, but should the plate actually look repellent?

A scoop of old chips and eight dollars later, I sat down to eat.  I expected the worst, and so I was mildly surprised to find that the burrito was, well, edible.  The carnitas was pleasantly textured and plenty salty.  Of course, the cheese was also salty, as were the beans, and the guac.  Anyway, I like salty just fine, so it was actually pretty tolerable; those with less of a hankering for sodium should be warned, though.

Actually, everyone should be warned.  This your ultra-basic, gringo burrito shop, gourmet in name only.  The burrito has length and girth . . . but size isn't everything.

Two stars rather than one because it's cheap for this area, and not visibly dirty.
author: Clay S.

description:
Saw all the great reviews from yelp about breakfast burritos from Alex's, so I decided to go and give it a try.  Got there at about 6:50am after catching the sunrise in the morning and was expecting a great treat.

To my surprise, the "gourmet" in Alex's gourment burrito is actually just a fancy way of tricking people into thinking this is something more than a fast food burrito from McDonalds or Carls Jr.  

Coming from southern California, where breakfast burritos are king, this couldn't even hold a candle to the beauty of a true Mexican burrito.  Alex made a burrito with soggy scrambled eggs, salsa, and some bacon.  No grilled tortilla, no hash browns/potatoes, no beans, and most importantly, their bacon was not crisp, but the soggy kind you get after microwaving frozen meat.  To top it off, I dont even think the owners were Mexican!

The service was great and everyone was friendly, but it just didn't taste good.

If you're looking for a breakfast burrito in northern California, keep looking, cause this is just not the place to get one, despite what the other reviews claim.
author: Sam T.

description:
delicious.  i'm usually not into the whole big fat meaty breakfast thing, but i figured i'd try it once.  and oh boy, i'm not really sure what's supposed to go into a breakfast burrito (i've seen some with rice and beans), but theirs is like breakfast in a tortilla: scrambled eggs, sausage, salsa and cheese.  nice and simple.  and when i say simple, that in no way means small, because this thing was huge!

it definitely filled me up for several hours (even after having only eaten ~80% of it).  had to follow it with a light lunch.

the lady there was nice too.  she said, eat here for breakfast and cancel all your lunch plans.  eat here for lunch and plan to go jogging.  i thought it was witty, but not super accurate.
author: spiff e.

description: I've only been for breakfast, and well, I'll admit, almost every time's been a hangover morning, but nonetheless, the breakfast burritos have been extremely tasty.  They're large, filling, spicy and pretty much make you want to take a nap rather quickly after eating.  The atmosphere for sitting to eat is not so good, but they give you the option of taking a plate and utensils to go with you, almost knowing that my office is always out of paper plates.  The owner is nice to customers and tells you to "come back again", but the control freak is super rude to her employees, picking at every little move they make.  I like the burritos (oh, and they even have whole wheat tortillas which is cool), but hate the awkward, uncomfortable feeling when she's being rude to her employees.
author: Holly M.

description: Don't go here unless you want generic, cafeteria level Mexican food. The woman who runs it has no clue. The food is over-priced and not tasty. Their burritos are just plain bad, the beans look left over from several days ago, the meat is salty and bland. I made the mistake of trying it twice. The second time my error was showing up for a late lunch, I mean were only talking 1:30pm, and she and her cook are already tearing down for the day. Not especially friendly either. Try the taco truck across the street much better.
author: Wade C.

description:
Why bother when there are much better places within a few blocks? I went here for the first time today because it was noon on the dot and I knew there would be a line at tlaloc. Bad idea. This place is bad food, badly prepared. Seven hours later I still regret it. 

I don't wish these guys any ill, but with better options two minutes away, it's time for them to bring up their game a notch. Do yourself a favor and walk to tlaloc or Orale or Pancho Villa.
author: Curtis M.

description: I visit the sweet ladies at Alex twice a week to further elevate my cholesterol to a level only achieved through delicious bacon-y goodness. I am fearless in the face of reason. Their breakfast burritos are that good.
author: Jill C.

description: Though I've never actually BEEN to this establishment, I get the boys from work to bring me their awesome burritos every Friday morning.  They are huge and delicious.  Lots of eggs, bacon, salsa and cheese.  I dare you to actually finish one.  Are there any better adjectives than cheap, fast and huge?
author: ellyk E.

description: I'll make it simple--the best burritos in San Francisco, seriously.  Just amazing.  A little messy, but you can ask for extra napkins.
author: Jordan B.

description: Best breakfast burrito in the financial district, can't speak for any other areas as I haven't been out of this area looking for one.  You can actually cut this in pieces and eat it over 2 or three mornings.   Generous amounts of eggs, meat, salsa, cheese.   I go for the eggs, bacon, cheese with jalepenos.
author: P H.

description: Love the breakfast burritos, egg w/ bacon & spicy to be specific. Not so much a fan of the regular lunch/dinner burrito. Service is great; very nice and appreciative of your patronage. Also helps this place is literally a half a block from where I work.
author: Brian S.

description: Unlike the last review, I felt like a bomb went off in my stomach. This is  worst breakfast burrito I have ever had. I would rather go to Latte Express and get a burrito with potatoes. The service sucks, the burrito lady was not friendly. Parking sucks if you drive. I give it half star.
author: Albert G.

description: Best breakfast burrito ever ever ever! I have a slight addiction to them. The lunch is not wonderful but the breakfast burrito earns them 5 stars in my book.
author: Sara F.

description:
i went to grab lunch at alex gourmet burritos b/c i've never tried it - now i know why.
b4 i even look at menu, BOSS/employee is grilling me on my order (um, back the f... up please)
 
after a few choice questions about the menu, i settle on a ensalada con pollo (yes, in a burrito shop). 
BUT, i want salad & i want it in a tortilla shell. 
 
apparently this is not an option. so the two employees exchange confused looks and a short discussion and state that the tortilla shell is for the soutwestern salad not the ceasar. in order to get the shell i needed to order the southwestern. 
 
my thoughts...'so what, didn't ask that & i want the shell for the ceasar salad.'  
i ask if the salads are PRE-prepared and the response is no. 
 
so WHY? WHAT is the major malfunction here then? 

i then ask, if it is possible to get the ceasar salad in the tortilla shell EVEN THOUGH the shell is specifically designated for the southwestern salad.
 
a long pause occurs and then it is decided that my lil request would cost .50 extra.

"OK, well then I want a ceasar salad in a tortilla shell - as orginally stated."
 
i go to the register to pay and get this - they ONLY TAKE ATM CARDS & there is a .50 charge. WTF?!  
 
the salad is just ok. but the shell is YUMMY. GLAD I STOOD MY GROUND.
author: r p.

description:
as i am writing this i am gorging on one of their infamous breakfast burritos.  they are the bomb no doubt about it.  i really think this visit should be a 31/2 star because they were "out" of chorizo???  i don't really think they were i just think they didn't really feel like prepping more.  i also notice that if you want a breakfast burrito after 10 you're kind of burnt.  
all that being said the food TASTES great and that is more important than anybody's attitude or nickel and diming tactics.  i only go there for the breakfast burritos that being said they are a favorite here in the office and deservedly so.
author: Anthony Y.

description: Anytime I see a self-declared superlative it's reason to be suspicious. I've been working a few days a week in the FiDi (For all of you who use "acronym" to describe an initialism, this is an actual acronym!) and have been looking for a great taqueria. I don't know about their popular breakfast burritos, but the lunchtime versions are far from gourmet. They're smallish with too high a rice to meat/beans ratio and full of mediocre ingredients and bland seasonings. The fact is that at any place in the shadow of the TransPyr (haha), you're paying more for real estate than food. I used to ply these streets in the 80s and remember a place just up the hill on Clay called Mi Burrito with killer delicious, cheap, and huge burritos. They had a heavenly barbequed beef burrito for $3.55 with all the stuffings now considered to be a super burrito, including all you can eat chips and salsa which Alex's sells for extra cost. In today's dollars, that's about $7.60 - roughly the price of Alex's burritos which are much smaller with inferior ingredients and too much rice. And since they only take cash, this almost certainly means they further pad their profits by not paying their fair share of taxes. I guess this is the only way for them to survive, but I'll pass.
author: David N.

description: Love this place.  Everything is prepared fresh daily, which is why its so fresh and tasty.  The owner is very friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere is casual and quiet.  Chicken verde super burrito, fish tacos, enchiladas, rotisserie chicken... all excellent and well-priced.  With this just down the block from Tlaloc and Mercedes, I don't why one would ever goe anywhere else.  Best burritos downtown by far!!
author: Alex T.

description: Pretty tasty food.  But not  worth haggling with the boss.  She's crabby.  She yells at her staff in front of the clientele.  She is constantly hovering over their shoulders. Its just bad bad bad. I've been a pretty loyal customer even as far back as when the restaurant was called Bur-Eat-Os.  On my last visit, they were out of most of the breakfast components, so I asked for extra salsa instead--and like always SHE charged me for it. Imagine charging $1 for an extra scoop of salsa (even though they were lacking everything else). In fact, She always nickels-and-dimes me for it. They charge extra if you want a wheat tortilla. They charge you if you want salsa to go.  WHAT?  This morning I went in for my usual breakfast burrito.  It was pretty early in the morning. The place was empty but I was not greeted as I stood there for five minutes two feet away from the boss lady.  Their customer service has always been horrible, so I left vowing to never go there again.  Their food is good but not worth it.
author: Nicole C.

description: There's nothing gourmet about this place. Absolutely gross. The breakfrast burrito I had was made in a huge pile of oil... not a little bit of butter or a little bit of oil- but in a pile of oil. The eggs were swimming in it. And when it was all put together, the whole thing leaked at least a quarter cup of oil out of the bottom. I was totally disgusted. Maybe the other burritos are ok, or i just had a bad experience, but I will never go back there. The inside is also like a cafeteria- not gourmet at ll.
author: Ann B.

description: For the FiDi this place makes a decent and quick burrito.  Simpler than the type of burrito you'll get at a taqueria in the Mission, but solid ingredients and I'm always satisfied for a quick lunch to take to the office. But the main reason I always come here is that the staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Not too long after starting to come to this place, they'd memorized my usual so that my order is now a smile and a nod.
author: James L.

description: The veggie burrito is the best I've had in the city!  Wonderfully cooked carrots, broccoli and zuchini.  This is my staple lunch.
author: jen b.
